titles.title: Federal Advertisement Reform Act
A bill to prohibit sponsorship of television violence by agencies of the Federal Government, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6127-6128)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

bill.summary: 5/19/1994--Introduced. Federal Advertisement Reform Act - Prohibits any Federal agency from advertising any product, program, or policy during any television program identified as having a high degree of violence as identified under this Act. Directs the National Telecommunications and Information Administration to establish a program to evaluate television programs with respect to their violent content. Includes national broadcasting and cable television programs within such evaluation. Requires the Administration to identify programs containing a high degree of violence and to publish a list of such programs in the Federal Register.
